title: Broken relative links in review/output docs (wrong ../ depth)

issue_details.description: Multiple review output and findings documents use incorrect relative paths (one level off). Links from docs/reviews/2026-Q1/outputs/ need 4 levels up to reach docs/, but many use only 2-3 levels.
issue_details.impact: Navigation broken for readers; automated link validation fails; review artifacts are disconnected from their templates/plans.
examples: CODE_REVIEW_2026_Q1.md links to ../CODE_REVIEW_PLAN_2026_Q1.md (should be ../../CODE_REVIEW_PLAN_2026_Q1.md from outputs/code-review/)
AUDIT_TRACKER.md links to ../reviews/... (should be ./reviews/...)
PERFORMANCE_AUDIT_FINDINGS links to ../templates/... (should be ../../templates/...)

steps: Adopt consistent rule: 'walk up to docs/ then down' for all docs/reviews/** files
Fix all relative links in CODE_REVIEW_2026_Q1.md, PERFORMANCE_AUDIT_FINDINGS_2026_Q1.md, AUDIT_TRACKER.md, PROCESS_AUDIT_PLAN_2026_Q1.md
verification: Click each Related Artifacts link in rendered Markdown view
Run internal-link validation script

evidence: GitHub Copilot: CODE_PATTERNS.md wrong path
Codex: 69 broken links detected
Claude Sonnet 4.5: 82 broken links detected
Claude Code Opus 4.5: 12 tool-validated broken links
ChatGPT 5.2: 75 broken links detected

title: [X] placeholders remain in 2026-Q1 plan instances

issue_details.description: Multiple 2026-Q1 plan instances still contain bracket placeholders like [X] (quarter markers Q[X], metric placeholders) that should have been replaced when instantiating from templates.
issue_details.impact: Plan execution is ambiguous; sync tooling fails; reviewers may copy incorrect paths/values.
examples: CODE_REVIEW_PLAN_2026_Q1.md has Q[X] at lines 514, 719
SECURITY_AUDIT_PLAN_2026_Q1.md has Q[X] at lines 639, 689
PERFORMANCE_AUDIT_PLAN_2026_Q1.md has numerous [X] for LCP/FID/CLS targets at lines 102-105, 619-621, 635-636

steps: Replace all [X] placeholders with concrete Q1 values or TBD
Run grep -n '\[X\]' docs/reviews/2026-Q1/*_PLAN_2026_Q1.md to find all instances
verification: grep returns 0 matches for [X] in plan instances
node scripts/check-document-sync.js --json reports success=true

evidence: Claude Sonnet 4.5: 18 [X] placeholders in PERFORMANCE_AUDIT_PLAN
Claude Code Opus 4.5: 28 placeholder issues across plans
ChatGPT 5.2: placeholders in 4 plan files

title: Tier 2 docs missing required metadata (Document Version, Applies To)

issue_details.description: DOCUMENTATION_STANDARDS.md defines Tier 2 required metadata as including Document Version and Applies To, but multiple docs labeled Tier 2 omit these fields.
issue_details.impact: Inconsistent metadata reduces trust; makes automation/maintenance harder; versioning and lifecycle state are unclear.
examples: APPCHECK_SETUP.md has Last Updated/Document Tier/Status but no Document Version
ANTIGRAVITY_GUIDE.md lacks Document Version
RECAPTCHA_REMOVAL_GUIDE.md lacks Document Version

steps: Add **Document Version:** X.Y and **Applies To:** ... to all Tier 2 docs
Or downgrade truly guide-style docs to Tier 5 with appropriate metadata
verification: Each Tier 2 doc includes required Tier 2 fields from DOCUMENTATION_STANDARDS.md
docs linter (docs:check) reports no Tier 2 metadata warnings

evidence: Claude Code Opus 4.5: Tier 2 metadata missing in 7+ docs
ChatGPT 5.2: Tier 2 compliance issues in 8 files

title: DOCUMENTATION_INDEX.md orphaned and missing required sections

issue_details.description: DOCUMENTATION_INDEX.md is not referenced by any markdown file in the repo, and docs linter reports it missing required sections (Purpose/Overview and Version History) and missing Last Updated metadata.
issue_details.impact: Primary navigation artifact is undiscoverable and incomplete; contributors default to README/tribal knowledge.
examples: Repo-wide search shows no markdown referencing DOCUMENTATION_INDEX.md
docs linter flags missing required sections and Last Updated metadata

steps: Add prominent link to DOCUMENTATION_INDEX.md from README.md
Add missing sections: Purpose/Overview and Version History
Decide tier and align metadata accordingly
verification: grep -R 'DOCUMENTATION_INDEX' -n *.md docs/**/*.md shows README.md referencing it
docs:check reports no errors for DOCUMENTATION_INDEX.md

evidence: Claude Code Opus 4.5: DOCUMENTATION_INDEX.md not referenced
ChatGPT 5.2: orphaned per link check + missing sections

title: Archive docs contain significant link rot after archival/moves

issue_details.description: Multiple archived documents contain broken links (e.g., linking to ./README.md, ./ROADMAP.md from within docs/archive/).
issue_details.impact: Archive becomes misleading; increases noise for link validators.
examples: docs/archive/AI_HANDOFF-2026-01-02.md contains (./README.md) and (./ROADMAP.md) which resolve to non-existent docs/archive/README.md
docs/archive/consolidated-2025-12-19/ARCHIVE_INDEX.md links to /AI_HANDOFF.md which doesn't exist at root

steps: Option A: Exclude docs/archive/** from link checks
Option B: Update archive links to correct relative paths (../../README.md etc.)
verification: Link validation within docs/archive/ shows reduced broken link counts
Spot-check top offenders in rendered view

evidence: Claude Code Opus 4.5: archive link rot noted
ChatGPT 5.2: archive docs have significant link rot

title: DOCUMENT_DEPENDENCIES.md claims SYNCED but has 30+ issues

issue_details.description: DOCUMENT_DEPENDENCIES.md declares 'Sync Status: SYNCED' in its header, but check-document-sync.js reports 30+ issues including broken links and missing files.
issue_details.impact: False sync status misleads maintainers; sync check failures are ignored.
examples: Header shows Sync Status: SYNCED
Actual check shows 30+ issues per automated tooling

steps: Run check-document-sync.js and fix all reported issues
Update Sync Status only after all checks pass
verification: node scripts/check-document-sync.js --json reports success=true
Header reflects actual sync state

evidence: Claude Code Opus 4.5: false SYNCED status with 30 issues

title: Standards/templates contain live placeholder links and incorrect anchors

issue_details.description: Several documentation 'example' links are written as live markdown links (not code fences), so they appear clickable and get treated as real by link checkers. DOCUMENTATION_STANDARDS references ROADMAP.md#dependencies which doesn't exist.
issue_details.impact: Link validation is noisier; readers may click dead references.
examples: DOCUMENTATION_STANDARDS.md:285 -> ../ROADMAP.md#dependencies but ROADMAP.md has no Dependencies heading
FOUNDATION_DOC_TEMPLATE.md:267 links to ../ROADMAP.md (should be ../../ROADMAP.md from docs/templates/)
PLANNING_DOC_TEMPLATE.md:25 and :330 have same issue

steps: Wrap illustrative examples in fenced code blocks
Fix intended real links in templates (docs/templates/* -> ../../ROADMAP.md)
Update or remove non-existent anchor references
verification: Link extraction confirms template/standards links resolve or are in code fences
ROADMAP.md headings confirmed for referenced anchors

evidence: ChatGPT 5.2: Standards/templates with placeholder links and bad anchor

title: PR_REVIEW_PROMPT_TEMPLATE lacks required metadata and version history

issue_details.description: PR review prompt template includes Created and Purpose, but lacks Last Updated, Status, and Version History section.
issue_details.impact: Harder to maintain and audit; consumers can't tell if it's current or deprecated.
examples: Header has Document Version + Created + Purpose, but no Last Updated/Status
No Version History section appears in document

steps: Add **Last Updated:** YYYY-MM-DD and **Status:** to header
Add Version History section with minimal table
Consider relocating to docs/templates/
verification: File contains Last Updated and Version History
Passes doc lint checks

evidence: ChatGPT 5.2: PR_REVIEW_PROMPT_TEMPLATE missing required metadata

title: CODE_PATTERNS.md referenced with incorrect path

issue_details.description: CODE_PATTERNS.md is referenced in some documents using incorrect relative path (wrong directory depth or missing docs/agent_docs prefix).
issue_details.impact: Readers cannot navigate to the anti-patterns reference; links fail.
examples: References to CODE_PATTERNS.md use paths that don't resolve correctly

steps: Search for all references to CODE_PATTERNS.md
Update to correct path: docs/agent_docs/CODE_PATTERNS.md
verification: All references to CODE_PATTERNS.md resolve correctly

evidence: GitHub Copilot: CODE_PATTERNS.md wrong path
Claude Code Opus 4.5: broken link to CODE_PATTERNS

title: Duplicate CODE_REVIEW_PLAN_2026_Q1.md exists in two locations

issue_details.description: CODE_REVIEW_PLAN_2026_Q1.md exists in both docs/ and docs/reviews/2026-Q1/, creating confusion about which is canonical.
issue_details.impact: Maintainers may update wrong file; divergence risk; confusion for audit operators.
examples: docs/CODE_REVIEW_PLAN_2026_Q1.md exists
docs/reviews/2026-Q1/CODE_REVIEW_PLAN_2026_Q1.md also exists

steps: Determine canonical location (recommend docs/reviews/2026-Q1/)
Delete or archive the non-canonical copy
Update all references to point to canonical location
verification: Only one CODE_REVIEW_PLAN_2026_Q1.md exists in codebase
All references updated

evidence: Claude Code Opus 4.5: duplicate file in two locations

title: Test count mismatch between DEVELOPMENT.md and actual test suite

issue_details.description: DEVELOPMENT.md claims a specific number of tests (e.g., 10 tests) but actual test suite may have different count.
issue_details.impact: Documentation misleads developers about test coverage.
examples: DEVELOPMENT.md states test count that doesn't match npm test output

steps: Run npm test and count actual tests
Update DEVELOPMENT.md with accurate count or remove specific number
verification: npm test output matches documentation claim

evidence: GitHub Copilot: test count mismatch finding

title: Template docs located outside docs/templates/ directory

issue_details.description: PR_REVIEW_PROMPT_TEMPLATE.md is a reusable template but is stored at docs/ rather than docs/templates/. Standards imply templates should live in docs/templates/.
issue_details.impact: Lower discoverability for contributors; inconsistency with other templates.
examples: PR_REVIEW_PROMPT_TEMPLATE.md at docs/ while other templates in docs/templates/

steps: Confirm if all templates should be under docs/templates/
If yes, move PR_REVIEW_PROMPT_TEMPLATE.md and update references
verification: All template files consistently located

evidence: ChatGPT 5.2: template location policy question

title: ROADMAP anchor links may be fragile due to emoji/punctuation in headings

issue_details.description: Links to specific heading anchors (e.g., #m16---...) can break if heading text changes due to emoji/punctuation differences in GitHub slug algorithm.
issue_details.impact: Low-to-medium: readers may land at top of document instead of intended section.
examples: ROADMAP.md links to ROADMAP_LOG.md using hard-coded anchor

steps: Avoid over-specific anchors for frequently edited headings
Manually verify anchor behavior in GitHub-rendered view
verification: Click anchor links in rendered ROADMAP.md and confirm scroll to intended section

evidence: ChatGPT 5.2: fragile anchor links suspected

title: Template date placeholders using literal YYYY-MM-DD format

issue_details.description: Templates contain date placeholders like YYYY-MM-DD or [Date] that should be replaced when instantiating but are sometimes copied literally.
issue_details.impact: Instances may have unparseable dates; tooling that expects ISO dates fails.
examples: Template files contain literal YYYY-MM-DD
Some instances may have copied this literally instead of replacing

steps: Ensure all template instantiation replaces date placeholders with actual dates
Consider using different placeholder format that's more obviously wrong if not replaced (e.g., <REPLACE_WITH_DATE>)
verification: No instance files contain literal YYYY-MM-DD or [Date]

evidence: Claude Code Opus 4.5: template date placeholders noted
